message.content:
cs.HC, cs.WEB, cs.IR, cs.MM, cs.SD 

The paper deals with the challenge of creating web applications for the multiscreen environment, which involves human-computer interaction (cs.HC), web development (cs.WEB), information retrieval (cs.IR), multimedia (cs.MM), and software development (cs.SD). The paper proposes a refactoring system that automatically analyzes the application content based on a semantic or a visual criterion determined by the author or the user, and prepares it for the splitting process. This involves techniques from various sub-fields of computer science, including natural language processing, computer vision, and software engineering. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.HC, cs.WEB, and cs.IR, followed by cs.MM and cs.SD.
